docs.snippet: Laszlo Szabo of Hungary retained the lead in the eighth round by the margin of half a point in the international chess masters tournament at Mar del Plata, according to a report received yesterday from Buenos Aires.
docs.lead_paragraph: Laszlo Szabo of Hungary retained the lead in the eighth round by the margin of half a point in the international chess masters tournament at Mar del Plata, according to a report received yesterday from Buenos Aires.

headline.main: SZABO KEEPS LEAD IN CHESS TOURNEY; Holds Half-Point Margin in Argentina Despite Draw in Rossetto Match

docs.snippet: MEXICO CITY, March 20 (AP) --Jimmy McLane, a veteran of two Olympics, and Wanda Lee Werner, a ninth-grade student from Bethesda, Md., swept to upset swimming victories today for the United States in the PanAmerican Games.
docs.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY, March 20 (AP) --Jimmy McLane, a veteran of two Olympics, and Wanda Lee Werner, a ninth-grade student from Bethesda, Md., swept to upset swimming victories today for the United States in the PanAmerican Games.

headline.main: McLane Triumphs in 1,500-Meter Swimming Race at Pan-American Games; FORMER YALE ACE DEFEATS KRAMER McLane Nips Argentine Star in 20:04--Americans Take Three Events in Rowing

docs.snippet: Miguel Najdorf, Argentina's international star, tied Laszlo Szabo, Hungarian grandmaster, for the lead at 7--2 in the chess tournament at Mar del Plata yesterday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Miguel Najdorf, Argentina's international star, tied Laszlo Szabo, Hungarian grandmaster, for the lead at 7--2 in the chess tournament at Mar del Plata yesterday.

headline.main: NAJDORF GAINS TIE FOR LEAD IN CHESS; Beats Letelier and Matches Szabo's 7-2 as Hungarian Star Draws With Ivkov

docs.snippet: MEXICO CITY, March 21 (AP) --The United States added to its Pan-American swimming laurels today by defeating Argentina in the men's 400-meter medley relay race.
docs.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY, March 21 (AP) --The United States added to its Pan-American swimming laurels today by defeating Argentina in the men's 400-meter medley relay race.

headline.main: U. S. Medley Team Defeats Argentine Swimmers; 400-METER EVENT CAPTURED IN 4:29.1 U. S. Beats Argentina by 20 Feet in Mexico City Swim --Miss Gundling Victor

docs.snippet: MEXICO CITY, March 22 (AP) --Mrs. Pat McCormick, the Olympic champion, captured the women's three-meter diving title is the United States swept the first three places at the PanAmerican Games today.
docs.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY, March 22 (AP) --Mrs. Pat McCormick, the Olympic champion, captured the women's three-meter diving title is the United States swept the first three places at the PanAmerican Games today.

headline.main: U. S. Women Sweep Three-Meter Diving in Mexico City; MRS. M'CORMICK CAPTURES TITLE Miss Stunyo, Miss Houghton Trail Olympic Champion in Pan-American Games

docs.snippet: Boris Ivkov of Yugoslavia gained ground in the international chess masters tournament at Mar del Plata yesterday, according to a report from Buenos Aires. He triumphed over Hector Rossetto, former champion of Argentina, in the tenth round.
docs.lead_paragraph: Boris Ivkov of Yugoslavia gained ground in the international chess masters tournament at Mar del Plata yesterday, according to a report from Buenos Aires. He triumphed over Hector Rossetto, former champion of Argentina, in the tenth round.

headline.main: IVKOV TIES NAJDORF FOR LEAD IN CHESS

docs.snippet: Laszlo Szabo lost for the first time in the eleventh round of the international chess masters tournament at Mar del Plata yesterday, according to a report from Buenos Aires. The Hungarian bowed to Oscar Panno, the champion of Argentina.
docs.lead_paragraph: Laszlo Szabo lost for the first time in the eleventh round of the international chess masters tournament at Mar del Plata yesterday, according to a report from Buenos Aires. The Hungarian bowed to Oscar Panno, the champion of Argentina.

headline.main: PANNO TOPS SZABO IN CHESS CONTEST; Argentine Pins First Defeat on Hungarian--Ivkov and Najdorf Draw Games

docs.snippet: Boris Ivkov of Yugoslavia and Miguel Najdorf of Argentina won their twelfth-round chess matches, according to a report received yesterday from Buenos Aires. As a result, the two remained tied for the lead in the international masters tournament at...
docs.lead_paragraph: Boris Ivkov of Yugoslavia and Miguel Najdorf of Argentina won their twelfth-round chess matches, according to a report received yesterday from Buenos Aires. As a result, the two remained tied for the lead in the international masters tournament at Mardel Plata.

headline.main: IVKOV STAYS TIED FOR LEAD IN CHESS; He and Najdorf Triumph for 9-3 Scores in Argentina --Szabo Places Third
U. S. BRIDGE TEAM GAINS; Wins Second-Round Match in Uruguayan Contest
